unnormalised: Infosys has announced a new software development program, "Step-Up," aimed at upskilling fresh graduates. The program, starting on 01/11/2024, will focus on full-stack development using Java, Python, and React. Participants will learn industry best practices for coding, testing, and deployment, covering topics like Agile methodologies and DevOps principles.
normalised: Infosys has announced a new software development program, "Step-Up," aimed at upskilling fresh graduates. The program, starting on first november two thousand and twenty four, will focus on full-stack development using Java, Python, and React. Participants will learn industry best practices for coding, testing, and deployment, covering topics like Agile methodologies and D-e-v-O-p-s principles.

unnormalised: The "Step-Up" program will be held at Infosys campuses across India, including Bangalore, Pune, and Chennai. Each campus can accommodate approximately 250 trainees. Successful completion of the program leads to placement as a Software Engineer at a salary ranging from Rs. 4.5 LPA to Rs. 6 LPA, depending on performance.
normalised: The "Step-Up" program will be held at Infosys campuses across India, including Bangalore, Pune, and Chennai. Each campus can accommodate approximately two hundred and fifty trainees. Successful completion of the program leads to placement as a Software Engineer at a salary ranging from rupees four point five L-P-A to rupees six L-P-A, depending on performance.

unnormalised: The curriculum incorporates hands-on projects mimicking real-world scenarios. Trainees will work on applications involving cloud services (AWS, Azure), database management (SQL, NoSQL), and cybersecurity protocols. Modules dedicated to AI/ML integration are planned for the 2nd phase of the program, expected to launch in Q2 2025.
normalised: The curriculum incorporates hands-on projects mimicking real-world scenarios. Trainees will work on applications involving cloud services (A-W-S, Azure), database management (S-Q-L, NoS-Q-L), and cybersecurity protocols. Modules dedicated to A-I slash M-L integration are planned for the second phase of the program, expected to launch in Q two two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: Applications are open now via the Infosys careers portal. Candidates must have a B.Tech/BE degree in Computer Science or related field, and a minimum aggregate score of 60% throughout their academic career. Last date to apply is 15/10/2024. More details can be found on their website under section "training programs".
normalised: Applications are open now via the Infosys careers portal. Candidates must have a B.Tech or B-E degree in Computer Science or related field, and a minimum aggregate score of sixty percent throughout their academic career. Last date to apply is fifteenth october two thousand and twenty four. More details can be found on their website under section "training programs".
